dict.string: if [ "$taskOpen" = "app" ]; then open "$myAppURL" else open "$myURL" fi
Modify task attributes, then ‚áß‚Ü©Ô∏è to save
Use @ to enter tags, # to assign to a project (default: Inbox), due: to add due date, ‚áß‚Ü©Ô∏è to create

# AlfreDo An Alfred Workflow for [Todoist](https://todoist.com/) ![](AlfreDo.png)
# New in v0.5 üéâ
Version 0.5 is a complete rewrite in Go, bringing several new features: - Editing, deleting, and setting deadlines for tasks - Natural language date parsing in multiple languages - Task Stamp feature to auto-add descriptions to new tasks
# Motivation ‚úÖ - Quickly list, search, and act on your Todoist tasks - Add new tasks to Todoist through Alfred
## Default settings - In Alfred, open the 'Configure Workflow' menu in `AlfreDo` preferences - set the Todoist API token (login into your account, then generate it [here](https://todoist.com/app/settings/integrations/developer)) - *Optional*: - set the keyword (or hotkey) to show: 1. Tasks due today (default: `!1`) 2. Overdue (default: `!2`) 3. All tasks (default: `!3`) 4. Tasks with deadline (default: `!4`) - set the keyword (or hotkey) to force-refresh (default: `todoist::refresh`) - set the keyword (or hotkey) to create a new task (default: `!!!`) - set refresh rate (in days). Default: `1` - Recommended `0` (refresh every time) or `1` if you use Todoist often from browser, mobile etc. - Database is automatically refreshed when a task is created, completed, or rescheduled. - Refresh can be forced using a keyword (default: `todoist::refresh`) or hotkey. - show Karma daily and weekly goals? Default: `yes` - partial match search? Default: `yes`. Search projects and labels anywhere in the string. Will search from start if unchecked - set an optional Task Stamp. Text entered here will be automatically added as description to new tasks created through AlfreDo. - open task in Todoist app, or website
# Basic Usage üìñ
## Searching your tasks üîç - launch with keyword or custom hotkey. You can start from 1) tasks due today, 2) tasks overdue, or 3) all tasks - Use multiple strings, or label/projects to refine search. Use `@` to enter one or more labels, `#` to enter a project. - Once a task is selected, you can do one of five things: - `enter` ‚Ü©Ô∏è will open the task on [Todoist](https://todoist.com/) - `shift-enter` ‚áß‚Ü©Ô∏è will complete the task - `ctrl-enter` ^‚Ü©Ô∏è will open a menu to reschedule the task. Choose one of the options, or enter a date in international format, with (`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM`) of without (`YYYY-MM-DD`) time, or enter a number of days. You can also use `w` or `m` after the number to enter weeks and months, respectively (e.g. `10w` will reschedule in 10 weeks). Time (in 24h format) can be added after these shortcuts as well (e.g. `7w13:13`). - alt-enter ‚å•‚Ü©Ô∏è will open the task for editing. - ctrl-alt-cmd-enter ‚åÉ‚å•‚åò‚Ü©Ô∏è will delete the task
## Creating new tasks ‚≠ê - launch with keyword (default: `!!!`) or hotkey. Use: - `@` to enter one or more labels (new ones can be created here), - `#` to enter a project (`Inbox` will be used if none entered), - `due:` to enter a due date, `p[1-4]` to enter a priority. As in reschedule, choose one of the options, or enter a date in international format, with (`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM`) of without (`YYYY-MM-DD`) time, or enter a number of days. or enter a number of days. You can also use `w` or `m` after the number to enter weeks and months, respectively (e.g. `10w` will set a due date in 10 weeks). Time (in 24h format) can be added after these shortcuts as well (e.g. `7w13:13`). - {deadline} to set a deadline using curly braces: {YYYY-MM-DD}, or relative expressions like {7d}, {3w}, {2m}. Natural language deadlines are also supported: {next friday}, {tomorrow} - Universal Action: new highlights can be created by selecting text in any app, then launching Universal Actions and selecting `Create a new Todoist task`.
## Database refresh üîÑ - will occur according to the rate in days set in `AlfreDo` preferences, after a task is created, completed, or rescheduled, or... - `todoist::refresh` to force database refresh
## Questions? üôã Report an issue [here](https://github.com/giovannicoppola/AlfreDo/issues)
Open task in app or todoist website
Login into your account, then generate it at https://todoist.com/app/settings/integrations/developer
Show Karma Daily and Weekly Goals?
Search projects and labels anywhere in the string. Will search from start if unchecked.
Optional. Description string added to all tasks created via AlfreDo. {timestamp} will add a timestamp. Example: 'Added via AlfreDo - {timestamp}'
Recommended 0 (refresh every time) or 1 if you use Todoist often from browser, mobile etc. Database is automatically refreshed when a task is created, completed, or rescheduled.
Where to open tasks in: app or browser
